radiographic_examinations.findings: Minor atelectasis at each lung base; trace bilateral pleural effusions; many small stones in the gallbladder (4 to 8 mm); no biliary dilatation; gallbladder mostly full with no wall thickening or edema; inflammatory changes in fat adjacent to the pancreas; pancreas enhances throughout; no organized fluid collection; normal spleen size; normal adrenal appearance; medium sized simple cyst in the mid left kidney (25 mm); no lymphadenopathy; widely patent major vascular structures; incidental replaced hepatic artery; unremarkable bone marrow signal intensities.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Inflammatory changes in the fat adjacent to the pancreas consistent with acute interstitial changes, similar to those seen on the recent CT scan.
